ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description: SendGrid Python library. This library allows you to quickly and easily use the SendGrid Web API v3 via Python
SendGrid Python library. This library allows you to quickly and easily use the SendGrid Web API v3 via Python

name: sendgrid
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "sendgrid" %}
{% set version = "6.12.5" %}

package:
  name: '{{ name|lower }}'
  version: '{{ version }}'

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 'ea9aae30cd55c332e266bccd11185159482edfc07c149b6cd15cf08869fabdb7'

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --no-build-isolation -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    # Note: the upstream requirements are a mess.  Some are in setup.py and some
    #       in requirements.txt, but the latter has exact version pins that are
    #       problematic for conda-forge and seem unnecessary.  They have other
    #       bounds that are inaccurately loose.  Details below.
    # consistent between setup.py and requirements.txt
    - cryptography >=45.0.6
    # need more recent version than in requirements.txt to support FullLoader
    - pyyaml >=5.1
    # consistent between setup.py and requirements.txt    
    - python_http_client >=3.2.1
    # missing from setup.py not usisng exact pin from requirements.txt but lowerbound is to support iteritems
    - six >=1.10
    # Using the most restrictive constraints for python >=3.12 here to stay noarch: python
    - werkzeug >=2.3.5
    # Note: flask is not needed as a runtime requirement and is only used for testing (but
    #       not on conda-forge)

test:
  requires:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}
  commands:
    - pip check
  imports:
    - sendgrid
    - sendgrid.helpers
    - sendgrid.helpers.inbound
    - sendgrid.helpers.mail

about:
  home: https://github.com/sendgrid/sendgrid-python/
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: SendGrid library for Python
  description: "SendGrid Python library. This library allows you to quickly and easily use the SendGrid Web API v3 via Python"
  doc_url: 'https://github.com/sendgrid/sendgrid-python'
  dev_url: 'https://github.com/sendgrid/sendgrid-python'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - RohitK89
    - mariusvniekerk
    - xylar
